title: Balázs Tóth (footballer, born 1981)
text:
Balázs József Tóth (, born 24 September 1981) is a retired Hungarian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>. He is a <a href="Hungary%20national%20football%20team">Hungarian international</a>.
Career.
Tóth signed a three-year contract with the Genk who upset the form book by finishing second in the Belgian First Division in 2005–06. Tóth started his career at <a href="Videoton%20FC">Videoton</a> before moving to Turkey with Malatyaspor midway through the 2004–05 season. He spent the 2005–06 season on loan at <a href="Kayseri%20Erciyesspor">Kayseri Erciyesspor</a>.
International career.
He made his senior international debut against <a href="Latvia%20national%20football%20team">Latvia</a> on 19 February 2004. He gained 34 caps and played his last international game for Hungary in the <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a> against <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a> on 11 August 2010.
